page.title: 02Tidbury Green Village
page.content: Tidbury Green is an unusual village in that at the present time there is no church, Village hall or Public House which most residents feel are needed to cultivate more of a "community spirit" ,the parish council have requested to purchase the vacant scout hut in order to renovate it and make it a central village hall.At the moment the school provides a central meeting place for various organisations and some social events. Over the last forty years there has been an increase in housing and population.The village now has piped water and sewerage.Farming has changed from nearly all Dairy and Cereal to more Beef and Sheep.Most of the field work was done by horses but to day it is all done by tractors .There are more cars and lorries on the roads than forty years ago.
